channel.title: jME - Community Project?
channel.description:
I thought it would be sick to do a community project using jME. For anyone thats never checked jme out: http://www.jmonkeyengine.com Take a look at the screenshots, its more than powerful enough. It's easy to use and theres some good tutorials.
Why don't we get a project rolling, maybe some sort of 3D viewer? Or a simple game? Maybe something that allows for plugins so it can be extended, idk, throw your ideas around here, let me know if you're up for it.
:)

@1st_Areo8 wrote:

I agree that jMonkey has good graphics and everything, but I’ve tried it and it can run slow at times. I’d suggest using a C language (like Tenac said).

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Moparisthebest:

When I said I know where to get really good motorcycle models, I was actually talking about Archer from the forums, he is great.

The models that people post in the graphics section really aren’t meant for games. With game models you want to have as low of a poly count as you can get while still looking good. You also want to be careful with textures, it’s not good to use more than 2 textures on one model. I guess it depends on which system specs you are targeting though.

If anything gets started I might be able to contribute a little bit.

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @Nader_H.I.M Nader[H.I.M]
item.description:
@Nader_H.I.M wrote:

Jme is Very good, and i am creating a game using it this summer.

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“ownagesbot, post:30, topic:278539”][quote author=Tenac link=topic=367679.msg2787955#msg2787955 date=1242586705]

[quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=367679.msg2787278#msg2787278 date=1242553730]

Instead of trying to start a community project (which will fail, sorry) why don’t you start writing it yourself? Maybe when you have something to show for it, as in, awesome screenshots and a few videos, people will be motivated to help you out.
I’m sure you are well intentioned, but it’s just not going to happen unless you take some initiative beyond pressing the new topic button.
[/quote]Lol…

Why did you laugh, I honestly think that’s the best advice here so far. Have you made any progress yet, do you have the knowledge to program a game like this, or do you just want to be a project manager and tell other people to make a game for you since it sounds cool?
[/quote]I know more than most, I just thought it’d be a cool thing to do as a community, I was thinking how well xEnt’s landscape editor went. I was only thinking of a 4week sort of project, nothing major. Meh.[/quote]Actually it was hardly the community when i wrote 90% of it (but labeled it a community project to inspire people this sort of stuff does work when managed properly) , but then again as Unhandled said, i started it off and made progress, few others helped along the way to create it. If i just said guys lets do this and i sat on the side and waited for some people to get it started, nothing would happen.

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Something like Habbo Hotel would be sick. Its a great idea because you can start small and expand it. If I can find anyone thats up for that style of game, id love to do it. Infact ill probably have a go at a basic game like that in jME.

Read full topic

Of course an MMORPG would be the ideal, but the problem is its such a big project it would never get finished.
[/quote]i dont think i need to point out how terrible this community generally is at writing servers[/quote]

Well, only the people who have a clue can write the server…

I do like the sound of something like coke studios (classic) or habbo hotel style in 3d…

And its easy too, similar idea to RS server… I’ve been making an isometric game engine for past 6 months now : )

Read full topic

Instead of trying to start a community project (which will fail, sorry) why don’t you start writing it yourself? Maybe when you have something to show for it, as in, awesome screenshots and a few videos, people will be motivated to help you out.
I’m sure you are well intentioned, but it’s just not going to happen unless you take some initiative beyond pressing the new topic button.
[/quote]Lol…

Why did you laugh, I honestly think that’s the best advice here so far. Have you made any progress yet, do you have the knowledge to program a game like this, or do you just want to be a project manager and tell other people to make a game for you since it sounds cool?[/quote]I know more than most, I just thought it’d be a cool thing to do as a community, I was thinking how well xEnt’s landscape editor went. I was only thinking of a 4week sort of project, nothing major. Meh.

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

When I said I know where to get really good motorcycle models, I was actually talking about Archer from the forums, he is great.

I’ve got an idea, we could come up with a game idea, I could implement it with panda3d and python, and you guys could do it with jME and java and we could turn it into a sort of competition, but one where everyone would win. (both are open source engines and languages, well actually java isn’t yet, but will be at version 7)

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @Wrauld Wrauld
item.description:
@Wrauld wrote:

[quote=“Tenac, post:19, topic:278539”]Go ahead, but you’ll need a story line, hundreds of models + textures, mini-quests throw into the game, weapon/skill/item system, game editor, and a lot more I’m sure.

It’s easy to say you want to make a game, brainstorm it, and start making it, but to make something people will play is almost impossible without a team of devoted people.

Personally, I’d say ditch jMe and go with C++ using OpenGL/SDL and make your own game engine to go with the game, I’ve done this and it’s more fun I think.[/quote]
Java, imo, would be better. C++ would be better for ‘bigger’ projects. This can be a simple project. And much easier to play…Look at runescape. Don’t look at moparscape.

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Of course an MMORPG would be the ideal, but the problem is its such a big project it would never get finished.

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

Go ahead, but you’ll need a story line, hundreds of models + textures, mini-quests throw into the game, weapon/skill/item system, game editor, and a lot more I’m sure.

It’s easy to say you want to make a game, brainstorm it, and start making it, but to make something people will play is almost impossible without a team of devoted people.

Personally, I’d say ditch jMe and go with C++ using OpenGL/SDL and make your own game engine to go with the game, I’ve done this and it’s more fun I think.

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

sandbox games are getting very popular now, and i have been wanting to make a wurm/garrysmod style game for a while now

they both have good concepts but both are poorly made and buggy as fuck, and taking ideas from both would make a pretty fun game imo

problem is no one wants/is capable to do shit in this community

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

you cant just know java and expect to be able to use a 3d engine, you have to learn every aspect of the engine

ps racing games suck, though its not a surprise mitb suggested it

Read full topic

item.title: jME - Community Project?
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

[quote=“ownagesbot, post:14, topic:278539”][quote author=communist link=topic=367679.msg2786125#msg2786125 date=1242502928]

Taharok has got a point. Programmers will clearly be sparse, especially those who know anything about jME.

If you know Java well enough, you’d be able to look at the documentation and be able to learn the constructors and methods…

I made a simple textured app in about an hour after reading this thread.
[/quote]Of course, but theres alot more to it than reading just the documentation. Without an understanding of jME the application will without doubt fail. jME is a very complex yet very simple easy to use engine, but it does require some effort and understanding.

I do agree though, anyone with a good java knowledge will pick it up within a couple hours.[/quote]

I tried another graphics engine, in C++ I think, last year, and I knew C++ then really well. It was reallly complicated, and hard to use.

With JME I can make a simple game in a day and a nice story game in a few months if I tried hard enough (And had all the renders etc ;))

Read full topic
